intro: Chondrilla juncea var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf chondrilla, is a perennial flowering plant native to regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is known for its low-growing habit and ability to thrive in arid environments. The species is also valued for its potential in phytoremediation due to its capacity to accumulate heavy metals.
